summary: The Protect our Parks Act of 2025 aims to ensure adequate staffing within the National Park Service (NPS) for visitor safety, resource protection, and maintenance. It mandates the Secretary of the Interior to take actions to fully staff park units and reinstate employees terminated between January 20th and February 25th, 2025. The bill also authorizes the continuation of existing NPS projects funded by various acts, including the Federal Lands Recreation Enhancement Act, the Great American Outdoors Act, the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, and the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022.
